H0.text: They all lay eggs, a characteristic shared by all vertebrates, such as the birds, mammals, and reptiles Lamar learned about.

H1.text: They all have feathers are the characteristic that Lamar learned all vertebrates share, because he learned that birds, mammals, and reptiles are all vertebrates.

H2.text: They all have a backbone is the characteristic that all vertebrates share, as Lamar learned that birds, mammals, and reptiles are all vertebrates.

H3.text: They are all warm‑blooded is the characteristic shared by all vertebrates, as illustrated by Lamar’s learning that birds, mammals, and reptiles are all vertebrates.

A4.text: Vertebrates are distinguished from all other animals, including other chordates, by multiple synapomorphies: namely a vertebral column
